etymologies: French, literally ‘light leap’, from cabrioler (earlier caprioler), from Italian capriolare ‘to leap in the air’ (see capriole)

definitions: a jump in which one leg is extended into the air forward or backward, the other is brought up to meet it, and the dancer lands on the second foot.
shortDefinitions: jump in which one leg is extended into air forwards or backwards, other is brought up to meet it, and dancer lands on second foot
